video.title: Ionic Framework 4 - Full Tutorial - iOS / Android App Development
video.description:
Learn how to use Ionic 4 in this full tutorial course for beginners. Ionic Framework is the free, open source mobile UI toolkit for developing high-quality cross-platform apps for native iOS, Android, and the web—all from a single JavaScript codebase. 

In this tutorial you will learn how to build a mobile app with Ionic and Angular from scratch. You will learn the basic concepts of Ionic and the Ionic CLI.

Course from Awais Mirza. Check out his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIKbbV7ae7LAWa8cGnvjSPA

Awais has a full stack JavaScript tutorial on Udemy: https://www.udemy.com/javascript-master-class/?couponCode=AWAIS80

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00:00) Introduction to Ionic 
⌨️ (00:12:20) Project Structure
⌨️ (00:23:44) Platform and Emulating
⌨️ (00:33:10) Emulating iOS
⌨️ (00:36:23) Emulating Android
⌨️ (00:39:34) Routing and Lazy Loading
⌨️ (00:51:17) Action Sheet
⌨️ (01:02:37) Components
⌨️ (01:15:55) ION Alert and Documentation
⌨️ (01:32:08) More Components
⌨️ (01:54:36) Side Menu and Tabs
⌨️ (02:16:37) Cordonva Not Available - fixed
⌨️ (02:26:26) Ionic Native
⌨️ (02:32:49) Debugging in Emulator using Safari
⌨️ (02:39:14) Debugging Using Webstorm
⌨️ (02:44:26) Native HTTP Plugins
⌨️ (02:53:20) Native SMS Plugins
⌨️ (02:56:55) Native Storage

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: Sir Cardo
topLevelComment.text:
Hello! I have a question: 
I can't see, at minute: 20:12, the 'Resources' folder.. When I start the command line "ionic start [name_project] --type=angular", the cmd doesn't ask if I want to integrate the new app with Cordova to target Android/iOS apps like at minute: 17:06 
I have installed Cordova, like he shown
It's a problem or not ?

replies.author: MineMeUp10
replies.text:
Don't know if you've found your answer or not, but you need to run the commands 
>ionic start --type=angular --cordova
or alternatively if you run the command
>ionic cordova build (insert IOS or android here)
The first command will build the project with cordova, as the default is to use capacitor these days.
The second command should add cordova to an already existing project. I highly recommend you look into capacitor first though.

topLevelComment.author: Aman Gupta
topLevelComment.text: is Ionic still uses the same technique like ionic 1 ? I worked with ionic 1 long back and have not been in touch with after that. the downside I observed was the performance hit, lagging due to webview.

replies.author: Amandeep Kochhar
replies.text: @Aman Gupta Yes it is. But i believe.... Bad Written native code will still be slower than Optimal Written Web View Code 😊

replies.author: Ujjal Kar
replies.text: now ionic support vue and react as well

replies.author: Amandeep Kochhar
replies.text: No it has been changed a lot! Ionic started using 95% of angular today. Performance cannot be compared to native mobile apps but if we write code optimally, we can get decent performance.
